newsitem.title: USA: News Corp not precluded from Time Warner.
newsitem.headline: News Corp not precluded from Time Warner.

text.p: Time Warner Inc's agreement to carry MSNBC, the all-news joint venture information service, on half of its cable systems does not preclude the systems from carrying a news channel produced by News Corp Ltd, Time Warner Cable spokesman Mike Luftman said Tuesday.
"There's nothing in the agreement with MSNBC that precludes carrying news from (News Corp's) Fox in the future," he said.
Time Warner talks with Fox about use of its 24-hour news channel have have broken off, Lufttman confirmed.
There are no talks "at present," he said.
MSNBC is produced by Microsoft Corp and General Electric Co's NBC.
Luftman said the agreement reached with MSNBC early this week meets requirements made by the Federal Trade Commission when it approved Time Warner's acquisition of Turner Broadcasting System Inc.
